visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chart with the following specifications: Chart type: line and column. Chart title: 'Monthly Weather Data'. Axes and labels styling: Use a dark blue color for the x-axis labels and titles, and a green color for the y-axis labels and titles. Data series: Include two series, one for 'Temperature' with data [29.9, 71.5, 106.4, 129.2, 144.0, 176.0, 135.6, 148.5, 216.4, 194.1, 95.6, 54.4] and another for 'Rainfall' with data [194.1, 95.6, 54.4, 29.9, 71.5, 106.4, 129.2, 144.0, 176.0, 135.6, 148.5, 216.4]. Custom colors: Use a light blue color for the 'Temperature' series and a dark green color for the 'Rainfall' series. Additional configurations: Set the chart margin right to 80 pixels, and use a white background for the chart.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts configuration is designed to render a dual-axis chart displaying monthly weather data. The chart includes two series: 'Temperature' displayed as a line chart and 'Rainfall' displayed as a column chart. The x-axis represents the months of the year, styled with dark blue labels and titles. The y-axis has two titles: 'Temperature' on the primary axis and 'Rainfall' on the secondary axis, both styled with green labels and titles. The 'Temperature' series is colored light blue, while the 'Rainfall' series is colored dark green. Additional configurations include setting the chart's right margin to 80 pixels and using a white background for the chart area.
